summary: This bill, the Foster Care Tax Credit Act, amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to create a refundable tax credit of $850 for eligible foster families. Eligibility is based on income and requires the child to reside with the family for at least one month. The bill also introduces information reporting requirements for placement agencies and courts placing foster children and includes provisions regarding penalties for improper prior claims. Furthermore, the bill mandates a study on the financial burdens of emergency and short-term foster placements and increases outreach efforts to provide information and educational material.
